body.p: Wm J Hales, formerly of Rockfort, Inda, a respectable and worthy young man, married in Union Co Ky -- There, in a difficulty with a man much larger than himself he was compelled to use a pen knife to defend himself.

The Examing Court held him over for trial, and his young wife mortgaged two a slave to her husbands surety, a Mr Jones, to indemnify him -- Young Hales has no estate of his own, and his wife depends on the hire of her two slaves for a livelihood.

Since the difficulty young Hales is in the Union Army, and his adversary it is
believed, is with the enemy --
The bail was forfeited for non appearance and Execution is out against the surety for the money -- which will of Course ultimately come out of Mrs Hales limited means --
The bond was for two hundred dollars, and I respectfully petition that the interest of the Commonwealth in the Judgment may be remitted --
The young man was in the service under the lamented Col Netters when the latter fell near this place in October September last.
I very much hope you will consider it a case for Executive clemency --

Very Respectfully
Yr obt Sevt
Geo H Yeaman

His Excellency
Gov Jas F Robinson

Union Cir. Ct
Will. J. Hales Pettn to remit forfeited bond
Forfeited bond in this case is remitted

Enclose to Geo. H. Yeaman
Owensboro
